title: Wing Stabilizer Anti-ice System The leading edges of the win…
caption_en: Wing Stabilizer Anti-ice System The leading edges of the wing and stabilizer are heated to prevent ice build-up. There are 2 wingstabilizer anti-ice vaives and they use the HP air from the engines for heating.

title: Both these 2 valves are controlled by the Integrated ECS Con…
caption_en: Both these 2 valves are controlled by the Integrated ECS Controller through the WINGSTAB switch. For the left WINGSTAB valve to operate, the L BLEED switch must also be ON. Likewise, the R BLEED switch must be ON for the right WINGSTAB valve operation. The WINGSTAB switch is also monitored by the ice detection system.

title: The WingStab anti-ice shut-off valves are powered by the lef…
caption_en: The WingStab anti-ice shut-off valves are powered by the left and right main busses respectively. These valves will close if they become electrically unpowered.

title: Selecting the WINGSTAB switch ON opens both the valves. The …
caption_en: Selecting the WINGSTAB switch ON opens both the valves. The HP air then flows into the leading edges of both the wings and the stabilizer.

title: This hot bleed air warms the leading edges via piccolo tubes…
caption_en: This hot bleed air warms the leading edges via piccolo tubes to prevent ice build-up. Piccolo tubes are tubes with holes in them, just like a flute. The excess air is vented overboard.

title: Temperature Control The wing skin temperatures on both wings…
caption_en: Temperature Control The wing skin temperatures on both wings are continuously monitored by the 2 wing skin temperature sensors. This information is sent to the Integrated ECS controller which modulates the anti-ice valves to maintain the colder of the wings

title: Apart from the 2 wing skin temperature sensors, there are 4 …
caption_en: Apart from the 2 wing skin temperature sensors, there are 4 overheat temperature sensors, one on each wing and stabilizer. They will be activated when they sense a temperature of more than

title: There are also 4 under-heat sensors, one on each wing and st…
caption_en: There are also 4 under-heat sensors, one on each wing and stabilizer. They will be activated when they sense a temperature of less than

title: The under-heat sensors monitor the wing and stabilizer tempe…
caption_en: The under-heat sensors monitor the wing and stabilizer temperatures and provide under-heat signals to the controller. If the wing temperature falls below 4C for more than 10 seconds, a caution CAS message WING TEMP LOW is displayed. For a low stabilizer temperature, the caution CAS message STAB TEMP LOW is displayed.

title: If the stabilizer skin temperature exceeds as sensed by the …
caption_en: If the stabilizer skin temperature exceeds as sensed by the over-heat sensor, a warning CAS message STAB OVHT is displayed. This is followed by a warning message STAB OVHT. For a wing overheat, the warning message WING OVHT is displayed on both CAS and The anti-ice valves do not close automatically.

title: If any of the stabilizer under-heat or overheat sensors fail…
caption_en: If any of the stabilizer under-heat or overheat sensors fails, an advisory CAS message STAB FAULT will be displayed. Likewise, for the wing sensors failure, an advisory CAS message WING FAULT will also be displayed.

title: WingStab Anti-ice Leak Detection The ducting for the wing an…
caption_en: WingStab Anti-ice Leak Detection The ducting for the wing and stabilizer anti-ice bleed air system is monitored by a leak detection unit. A series of inter-connected heat detection elements is routed beside the anti-ice ducting and ends at the leak detector unit.

title: These warnings remain on until the temperature decreases. No…
caption_en: These warnings remain on until the temperature decreases. Note that the wingstabilizer anti-ice valves do not close automatically.

title: The flight manual corrective procedure for this malfunction …
caption_en: The flight manual corrective procedure for this malfunction is to turn the STABWING anti-ice switch off and avoid flight into icing conditions.

title: WingStab Anti-ice System Test The WingStab anti-ice system i…
caption_en: WingStab Anti-ice System Test The WingStab anti-ice system is tested with the ANTI-ICE position on the system test knob. A satisfactory test is followed by the warning messages WING OVHT and STAB OVHT and an advisory CAS message WGSTAB HT OK.
